meanings.definition: Divided or split into smaller parts
meanings.sent1: The splintered group could not agree on a plan.
meanings.sent2: The team's splintered efforts led to confusion.
meanings.sent3: The splintered puzzle pieces made it impossible to solve.
meanings.sent4: His attention was splintered among too many tasks.
meanings.sent5: The splintered road diverged into multiple paths.

meanings.definition: To cause something to break into sharp, thin pieces
meanings.sent1: She accidentally splintered the delicate vase.
meanings.sent2: The hammer splintered the wooden plank with one strike.
meanings.sent3: He tried to splinter the rock but only managed a small crack.
meanings.sent4: The explosion splintered the glass windows into fragments.
meanings.sent5: The force of the impact splintered the tree trunk into pieces.
